  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>eun</catalog>
            <entry>14765</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="it">Lavora con il dizionario</string>
            <string language="lv">Work with dictionary</string>
          </title>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="it">L'esercizio ha le seguenti parti: 1)libero movimento di..... 2) diritto di ..... 3)multi-..... 4) principio di ....  E' un esercizio di abbinamento 
(drag and drop) che inserisce l'uso del dizionario. Potrebbe essere usato come  test di verifica su frasi inglese-lettone e termini sulla conoscenza riguardo alla UE. L'esercizio è inteso per discenti di livello intermedio nelle scuole lettoni.</string>
            <string language="lv">The exercise has got the following parts:
1)	`free movement of…`,
2)	`right to…`,
3)	`multi-…`,
4)	`principle of…`.
It is a matching (drag-and-drop) exercise involving work with a dictionary.
It could be used as a test-exercise on English-Latvian phrases and terms based on the knowledge about the EU.
The exercise is meant for the learners of the upper-intermediate level in Latvian schools.</string>
          </description>
        </general>

        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>
            <source>LRE.learningResourceTypeValues</source>
            <value>web page</value>
          </learningResourceType>
          <intendedEndUserRole>
            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>
            <value>learner</value>
          </intendedEndUserRole>
          <context>
            <source>LRE.contextValues</source>
            <value>compulsory education</value>
          </context>
          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">15-U</string>
            <string language="lv">> 15</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="it">Innanzitutto dovrebbero essere discusse tematiche quali UE e cittadinanza europea nelle lezioni di scienze Sociali per conoscere le informazioni necessarie ed il materiale di studio. Poi gli studenti dovrebbero avere i testi di cui parlare in inglese per confrontarli con quelli lettoni. Gli scopi: 1) ampliare le conoscenze dei discenti sulla storia e sulla struttura della UE e della cittadinanza europea.
2) Apprendere termini inglesi e lettoni basati sulla UE e sulla cittadinanza europea. 3) Conoscere ed utilizzare il GLOSSARIO DELLA TERMINOLOGIA DELLA UNIONE EUROPEA inglese, francese, lettone ( Angļu-franču-latviešu EIROPAS SAVIENĪBAS TERMINU VĀRDNĪCA )Tulkošanas un terminoloģijas centrs, 2004; Grāmatu apgāds „Madris”, 2004; Rīga.</string>
            <string language="lv">First of all, topics “The EU” and “European citizenship” should be discussed in the lessons of social sciences to get acquainted with the necessary information and study material. Then the students should get the discussed material (texts) in English to compare them with the Latvian ones.
The goals:
1) To widen knowledge of learners in the history and the structure of the EU and European citizenship.
2)To learn English-Latvian terms based on / connected with the EU and European citizenship.
3) To get acquainted with and to use Angļu-franču-latviešu EIROPAS SAVIENĪBAS TERMINU VĀRDNĪCA (English-French-Latvian GLOSSARY OF EUROPEAN UNION TERMINOLOGY) , Tulkošanas un terminoloģijas centrs, 2004; Grāmatu apgāds „Madris”, 2004; Rīga.</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
